1.text: Freeze your glasses ahead of time, if desired.

2.text: Place 2 large scoops of ice cream into each glass.
2.vid: /6/69/Make a Root Beer Float Step 2 Version 3.360p.mp4

3.text: Divide the root beer between the 2 glasses.
3.vid: /1/14/Make a Root Beer Float Step 3 Version 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Pop the glasses back into the freezer for another 10 minutes, if desired.

5.text: Garnish the root beer float, if desired, then serve it immediately.

6.text: Place half of the ice cream and root beer into a blender.
6.vid: /e/e6/Make a Root Beer Float Step 6 Version 3.360p.mp4

7.text: Blend the root beer until it is smooth.
7.vid: /6/66/Make a Root Beer Float Step 7 Version 3.360p.mp4

8.text: Divide the root beer between 2 tall glasses.
8.vid: /9/9d/Make a Root Beer Float Step 8 Version 3.360p.mp4

9.text: Top the glasses off with more root beer and a scoop of ice cream each.
9.vid: /f/f1/Make a Root Beer Float Step 9 Version 3.360p.mp4

10.text: Garnish the root beer floats, if desired, then serve them immediately.

11.text: Place the ice cream and root beer into a blender.
11.vid: /4/4c/Make a Root Beer Float Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4

12.text: Blend the ice cream and root beer until they are smooth.

13.text: Add some ice if you want a thicker treat.
13.vid: /e/e3/Make a Root Beer Float Step 13 Version 2.360p.mp4

14.text: Divide the root beer freeze between 2 tall glasses.
14.vid: /e/eb/Make a Root Beer Float Step 14 Version 2.360p.mp4

15.text: Garnish and serve the root beer freeze.

16.text: Make a chocolate root beer shake.

17.text: Try it with other sodas and ice creams.

18.text: Add a splash of alcohol to make it a spiked root beer float.

19.text: Mix up a root beer martini for a fancier treat.

20.text: Turn a root beer freeze into popsicles.
